page.title: 12CONSERVATION
page.content: Youlgrave is one of the most attractive and historic villages in the{Peak District National Park.}In 1983 much of the village became one of the 20 conservation areas in the Peak Park. This means that people have to get permission to demolish buildings or cut down trees and planning applications have to be advertised by the Peak Park Planning Board. Since we became a conservation area money has been made available by the Planning Board to repair the Fountain, plant new trees in the dale and repair some of the dry stone walling. In our area kingfishers, herons and badgers are all to be found but people who know where their nests and setts are don't tell others so that they won't be harmed. There is a nature reserve in{Lathkill Dale.} Dakin Shimwell (11)
